poem:
**An Unlikely Proposal**

In the trailer, under the trailer park sky,  
a voice slips through like a misplaced line  
from a script—a twist in the plot.  
An invitation wrapped in real estate  
and bright gold promises—  
but destiny turns her back,  
a phone left unanswered  
as the film carries on,  
and life, too, waits  
for no second take.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Love? Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
